display-not-lighting.title: Display Not Lighting
steps: Check main power connection at CN7
Verify 24VDC at power supply output
Check F1 fuse (main power fuse)
Inspect ribbon cable from display to main board
Check for LED indicators on control board

door-wont-move.title: Door Won't Move
steps: Verify operation mode selector is not in OFF position
Check for error codes on display
Test activation sensors (motion/presence)
Verify encoder connection at CN2
Check motor cable connections
Test with manual jog using push buttons
Check for mechanical obstructions

door-slams.title: Door Slams/Closes Too Fast
steps: Check closing speed parameter settings
Verify encoder is reading correctly
Run Learn cycle to recalibrate
Check for loose belt or drive components
Inspect for damaged encoder disc

fuse-blowing-f2.title: F2 Fuse Blowing (Motor Fuse)
steps: Disconnect motor and test fuse
Check motor winding resistance
Inspect motor cable for damage/shorts
Check for mechanical binding
Verify motor type setting matches installed motor

fuse-blowing-f3.title: F3 Fuse Blowing (Accessories)
steps: Disconnect all accessories
Check 24V accessory load
Inspect sensor wiring for shorts
Test fuse with accessories disconnected
Reconnect accessories one at a time

encoder-errors.title: Encoder Errors
steps: Check encoder cable connection at CN2
Verify encoder disc is clean and undamaged
Check encoder mounting and alignment
Test encoder output with multimeter
Verify motor type parameter setting

lock-errors.title: Lock Errors
steps: Verify lock type parameter matches installed lock
Check lock cable connections
Test lock manually with 24V direct
Inspect lock mechanism for damage
Check lock mounting and alignment

obstruction-detection.title: False Obstruction Detection
steps: Clean track and floor guide
Check for debris in door path
Verify presence sensors are clean
Adjust obstruction sensitivity parameter
Run new Learn cycle

battery-failure.title: Battery/Emergency Unit Failure
steps: Check battery voltage (should be 24V nominal)
Verify battery connections are secure
Test battery under load
Check emergency unit if installed
Verify charging circuit is functioning

grinding-noise.title: Grinding or Unusual Noise
steps: Inspect belt for wear or damage
Check belt tension and alignment
Inspect hanger rollers for wear
Check motor bearings
Verify door panels are not rubbing

learn-cycle-failure.title: Learn Cycle Failure
steps: Verify door moves freely by hand (power off)
Check for obstructions in full travel path
Ensure all sensors are connected properly
Verify lock is releasing (if installed)
Check for error codes after Learn attempt

slow-operation.title: Door Operating Slowly
steps: Check speed parameter settings
Verify Run Program parameter
Inspect for mechanical friction
Check belt tension
Test in different operation modes

sensor-issues.title: Sensor Not Detecting
steps: Verify 24V power at sensor
Check sensor alignment and coverage
Clean sensor lens
Test sensor output with multimeter
Verify sensor type parameter setting

E04.action: Run Learn cycle, check for obstructions

E05.action: Check lock type setting and connections

E09.action: Reset, if persists replace control board

E10.action: Reset to defaults, replace board if persists

E11.action: Let motor cool, reduce duty cycle

function-test.title: Function Test
steps: Set operation mode to AUTO
Trigger opening sensor - door should open
Wait for hold-open time - door should close
Test presence sensor - door should hold open
Test from both sides

encoder-test.title: Encoder Test
steps: Access parameter menu
Navigate to encoder count display
Push door by hand slowly
Verify count changes smoothly
Check for missing counts or noise

motor-test.title: Motor Test
steps: Disconnect motor from belt
Use jog buttons to run motor
Listen for smooth operation
Check for excessive heat
Measure current draw

learn-cycle.title: Learn Cycle
steps: Set operation mode to AUTO
Press and hold Learn button 2 seconds
Display flashes 'L'
Door closes, opens slightly, closes again
Door opens fully, pauses, closes
Display shows 'on' when complete

save-parameters.title: Save Parameters
steps: Make desired parameter changes
Press Select to confirm each change
Press Exit to return to normal mode
Parameters auto-save to EEPROM
Power cycle to verify retention

display-not-lighting.title: Display Not Lighting / Extinguished
steps: Check mains power at power supply unit
Verify power supply cable connection to main control unit
Check for blown fuses (10AT rated)
Perform a RESET using operation mode selector
If display remains off, replace main control unit or power supply

door-wont-move.title: Door Won't Move
steps: Check operation mode selector is not in OFF position
Check display for error codes (E1-E8)
Disconnect mains power, manually push door to verify no mechanical binding
Check floor guide for debris, sand, or stones
Verify motor and encoder cables are connected
Check Motor Type configuration parameter matches installed motor
Test activation sensors

sensor-error-e1.title: E1 Sensor Errors
steps: Check monitoring output connections for all sensors
Verify inner activation unit test pulse (error 19)
Check fire alarm connections (error 20)
Verify stop impulse connections (error 30)
Check side presence sensor connections (error 31)
Verify presence sensor connections (error 32)
Replace faulty monitored activation unit if connections OK

emergency-unit-error-e2.title: E2 Emergency Unit Errors
steps: Check battery voltage - charge or replace if low (error 21)
Verify battery cables are connected and not short circuited (error 25)
Check battery internal thermal fuse
Verify door can open to fully open position (error 26 - timeout)
Check for high friction or jammed door preventing emergency test
Replace escape route unit if battery measurement wrong

electronic-unit-error-e3.title: E3 Electronic Unit Errors
steps: RESET the operator first for all E3 errors
Check for flashing or extinguished LED on electronic units
Error 00 (RAM): RESET, replace unit with flashing LED if persists
Error 01 (ROM): RESET, replace unit with flashing LED if persists
Error 02 (EEPROM): Download default parameters, RESET, replace MCU if persists
Error 14 (Lock Current): Check correct lock installed, replace lock or MCU
Error 17 (Hardware Watchdog): RESET, replace MCU if persists
Error 22 (24V Overcurrent): Check connected sensors and accessories
Error 24 (Learn): Check door can complete full open/close cycle

motor-encoder-error-e4.title: E4 Motor/Encoder Errors
steps: Verify encoder cable is connected (error 03, 09)
Verify motor cable is connected (error 03, 04)
Check Motor Type configuration parameter
Inspect cables for damage
Replace encoder cable if damaged (error 09)
RESET and retest

lock-error-e5.title: E5 Lock Errors
steps: Check lock is operating without friction (error 07)
Verify Hold Force parameter is set correctly
Verify Lock Release parameter is set correctly
Make sure door can move first 9/16 inch (14mm) from closed
Check lock mounting and alignment

communication-error-e6.title: E6 Communication Errors
steps: Push Learn button for 2 seconds to re-recognize modules
RESET the operator
Error 12: Motor control processor - replace MCU if persists
Error 13: Door control processor - replace MCU if persists
Error 36: Escape route unit - replace escape route unit if persists
Error 37: I/O unit - replace I/O unit if persists
Error 51: Web unit - replace web unit if persists
Error 53: Operation mode selector - check connections, replace if persists

motor-temperature-high-e7.title: E7 Motor Temperature High
steps: If motor is warm, set door to OPEN mode and wait at least 1 minute
Reduce speed parameters
Increase Hold Open Time parameter
Check if heavy-duty motor was replaced with normal duty motor
If motor was replaced, wait 5 minutes in OPEN mode
Check for mechanical friction increasing motor load

door-hard-to-move.title: Door Hard to Move Manually
steps: Disconnect mains power and unlock all mechanical locks
Pull door manually over complete sliding track
Check floor guide for sand, stones, rubbish
Check if door is jamming on floor or sweeps
Clean floor guide thoroughly
Adjust door leaf height/depth if rubbing
Replace wear parts if necessary

learn-cycle-failure.title: Learn Cycle Failure (Error 24)
steps: Verify door can make a full open/close cycle manually
Check for high friction - clean track and guide
Check if door is jammed or obstructed
Verify all sensors are connected
Check lock is releasing properly
Run new Learn cycle after clearing obstruction

E1-19.meaning: Inner Impulse Error - no test answer from activation unit
E1-19.action: Check monitoring output connections, replace inner activation unit

E1-20.meaning: Fire Impulse Error - no test answer from fire alarm

E1-30.meaning: Stop Impulse Error - no test answer from stop impulse

E1-31.action: Check connections, replace side presence activation unit

E1-32.action: Check connections, replace presence activation unit

E2-21.meaning: Emergency Unit Error - low battery voltage
E2-21.action: Charge or replace battery, replace escape route unit or MCU

E2-25.meaning: Battery Error - disconnected, short circuit, or thermal fuse blown
E2-25.action: Check cables, charge/replace battery, replace MCU

E2-26.meaning: Emergency Action Timeout - door prevented from opening
E2-26.action: Ensure door can open to fully open position

E3-00.action: RESET, replace unit with flashing/extinguished LED

E3-01.action: RESET, replace unit with flashing/extinguished LED

E3-02.action: Download default parameters, RESET, replace MCU

E3-08.action: RESET, replace unit with flashing/extinguished LED

E3-10.action: RESET, replace unit with flashing/extinguished LED

E3-11.action: RESET, replace unit with flashing/extinguished LED

E3-14.action: Check correct lock installed, replace lock or MCU

E3-17.meaning: Hardware Watchdog Error - cannot disable motor bridge

E3-22.action: Check connected sensors and accessories, RESET

E3-23.meaning: Lock Circuit Error - cannot disconnect lock with relay

E3-24.meaning: Learn Error - Learn cycle timed out
E3-24.action: Check door can complete full cycle, check for friction/jamming

E3-27.action: Check lock installation, verify limit switches working, replace lock

E3-33.meaning: Flash Code Error - serious programming error

E3-34.meaning: Output Enable Error - safety circuit test failing

E4-03.meaning: Encoder Error - encoder/cable/motor damaged or wrong motor type
E4-03.action: Check cables, verify Motor Type configuration

E4-04.meaning: Motor Current Error - motor/encoder cable damaged
E4-04.action: Check cables, verify Motor Type configuration

E4-09.action: Check encoder cable, replace if damaged

E5-07.meaning: Lock Failure - door prevented from opening first 14mm
E5-07.action: Check lock operates without friction, verify Hold Force and Lock Release parameters

E6-12.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace MCU

E6-13.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace MCU

E6-36.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace escape route unit

E6-37.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace I/O unit

E6-51.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace web unit

E6-52.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace Hi-O unit

E6-53.action: Push Learn 2 sec, check connections, replace selector

E6-54.meaning: External Communication Error - external bus malfunction
E6-54.action: Push Learn 2 sec, RESET, replace MCU

E7-16.meaning: Motor Temperature High - duty cycle too high
E7-16.action: Set to OPEN mode, wait 1+ min, reduce speeds, increase Hold Open Time

E8-49.meaning: EEPROM Non-critical Write Error - cannot write log info
E8-49.action: RESET, replace MCU if logging needed

E8-50.action: Reduce events to log in Event Log configuration

learn-cycle.title: Learn Cycle
steps: Set Program Selector to AUTO position
Connect all accessories with well-adjusted sensors
Connect main power plug to control unit
Door will move to closed position with low speed if open
Push Learn button (LB) for 2 seconds - display flashes 'L'
Door closes, opens slightly, closes again (detects lock type)
Door opens fully (calculates friction), pauses 4-10 sec
Door closes (calculates weight and adjusts speed)
Display shows 'on' when complete
If 'P' + digits shown, manually adjust indicated parameters

factory-reset.title: Factory Reset / Default Parameters
steps: Push Learn/Exit button for 10 seconds
Display will flash 'L' while holding
When 'on' is displayed, default parameters are restored
Run new Learn cycle after reset

parameter-adjustment.title: Parameter Adjustment
steps: Push Select button - display shows rotating test pattern
Verify all 7 segments light in both display windows
Push Select again - displays parameter ID (two digits)
Use Up/Down buttons to select desired parameter
Push Select to see current value (flashing digits)
Use Up/Down to adjust within allowed range
Push Select to confirm new value
Push Exit or wait 10 seconds to return to normal 'on'

lock-function-test.title: Lock Function Test (LDP or LDB)
steps: Set operation mode selector to EXIT
Door should open and close without sound from lock
Set operation mode selector to OFF
Try to open door by pulling - should not open
Set back to EXIT
Listen for two clicks (LDB) or one click (LDP) indicating unlock
Door should now open and close without lock sound

module-recognition.title: Module Recognition
steps: Push Learn/Exit for 1 second (not 2)
Each connected electronic module will be recognized
Operation mode selector will be recognized
Use after replacing or adding any electronic unit

items.IOU: I/O Unit P/N 1007779 - Fire alarm, error indication, Open/Close, Nurse function

general-troubleshooting.title: General Troubleshooting (Legacy System)
steps: NOTE: This is a legacy Besam system - manual is scanned images
Check power supply at main board
Verify motor connections
Check encoder/feedback system
Inspect belt and mechanical components
Test sensors manually
For detailed procedures, refer to physical manual

besam-unislide.note: Legacy system - detailed diagnostics require physical manual review. PDF is scanned images without extractable text.

general-troubleshooting.title: General Troubleshooting (Legacy System)
steps: NOTE: This is a legacy 1999 Besam system - manual is scanned images
Check power supply connections
Verify motor and drive system
Check AMD II controller board
Inspect mechanical components
Test activation sensors
For detailed procedures, refer to physical manual

besam-powerglide.note: Legacy 1999 system - detailed diagnostics require physical manual review. PDF is scanned images without extractable text.

door-wont-open.title: Door Does Not Open / Motor Does Not Start
steps: Check control switch is not set to OFF - change setting if needed
Verify electrical power is present - check power switch
Test activation unit by strapping impulse inputs
Check that presence detection is not activated - ensure no objects in detection zone
Verify KILL is not activated - deactivate KILL if active
Check potentiometer SPTE is turned to 0°
If motor starts but door doesn't move: check mechanical lock is unlocked
Check for objects jammed beneath the door
Check if electric striking plate is binding - select lock release, adjust striking
Verify arm system has not come loose - tighten if needed

door-wont-close.title: Door Does Not Close
steps: Check control switch is not set to HOLD - change to AUTO or EXIT
Verify presence impulse is not being activated - remove objects from detection zone
Check for objects jammed beneath the door - remove any obstructions

unknown-spring-tension.title: Operator Has Unknown Spring Pre-tension
steps: Turn up potentiometer SPTE until door stop can be loosened
Remove the door stop and the arm system
Unplug electrical power and let spring close
Unplug the motor plug
Mount drive arm and find 0 pre-tension by moving back and forth
Loosen the arm
Connect the motor plug
Turn SPTE pot to 180° and wait until spindle stops turning
Connect electrical power - operator will tension spring to factory 720°
Mount door stop against closing stop block
Turn SPTE to 0° - operator is now factory set
Proceed to adjust open stop position per section 12

kill-impulse-active.title: Kill Impulse Active (1 flash, 10s pause)
steps: LED shows: One 0.3s flash, then 10 second pause, repeating
Make a kill reset
Reset kill switch
Reset fire alarm if connected

external-24v-error.title: 24V DC External Error (1 flash, 2s pause)
steps: LED shows: One 0.3s flash, then 2 second pause, repeating
Check for short circuit on 24VDC accessories
Inspect sensor wiring for damage

sensor-monitoring-error.title: Sensor Monitoring Error (1 flash, 2s pause)
steps: LED shows: One 0.3s flash, then 2 second pause, repeating
Check for broken monitored sensor
Verify sensor connections
Replace faulty sensor

control-unit-defective.title: Control Unit Defective (3 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Three 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Replace control unit CU-200

encoder-error.title: Encoder Error (4 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Four 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Check the encoder cable connections
Open and close the door manually
Check automatic function after manual operation
If still not functioning, replace drive unit

locking-device-defective.title: Locking Device Defective (5 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Five 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Check for short circuit in locking device
Replace locking device if shorted
If not the lock, replace EXU-SI board

sync-cable-error.title: Sync Cable Error - Double Door Only (6 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Six 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Check sync cable is connected (double door installations)
Replace sync cable if defective

slave-control-defective.title: Slave Control Unit Defective - Double Door Only (7 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Seven 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Check the flash frequency on the SLAVE LED
Take action based on SLAVE error code per this troubleshooting guide
Replace slave control unit if needed

motor-overheated.title: Motor Overheated (8 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Eight 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Wait for the motor to cool down
Check for mechanical binding causing motor strain
Reduce duty cycle if possible

blocked-door-constant-impulse.title: Blocked Door with Constant Impulse (9 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Nine 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Toggle impulse to reset
Check for mechanical obstruction
Verify sensor is not stuck in activate state

learn-required.title: Learn Required or Learn Failed (10 flashes)
steps: LED shows: Ten 0.3s flashes, then pause, repeating
Settings have been made that require a new learn cycle
Or the previous learn cycle failed
Check setup and arm configuration
Perform new learn cycle

1-flash-10s.action: Make kill reset, reset kill switch or fire alarm

1-flash-2s.meaning: 24V DC external error OR sensor monitoring error
1-flash-2s.action: Check for short circuit or broken monitored sensor

4-flashes.action: Check encoder cable, manually cycle door, replace drive unit if needed

5-flashes.meaning: Locking device or EXU-SI board defective
5-flashes.action: Check for short in lock, replace lock or EXU-SI

6-flashes.meaning: Sync cable not connected or defective (double door)

7-flashes.action: Check slave LED, troubleshoot slave, replace if needed

8-flashes.action: Wait for motor to cool down

learn-cycle.title: Learn Cycle
steps: Ensure arm system is properly mounted and adjusted
Verify door stop is in correct position
Turn SPTE potentiometer to 0°
Press the LEARN button on CU-200
Status LED starts to blink
Let door complete full open/close cycle without touching
LED stops blinking when learn is complete

change-parameter-group.title: Change Parameter Group
steps: Disconnect mains plug
Press and hold LEARN button while connecting mains plug
Watch ERROR LED - it will illuminate for 3s, off 1s, on 5s, off 5s, on 1s
Release LEARN button after the 5 seconds (LED is out)
ERROR LED flashes to show current group number
Push LEARN button once to increment to next group
When desired group reached, disconnect mains plug
Next power-on will use new group settings

revert-backcheck-latch-defaults.title: Revert Back-Check and Latch-Check to Defaults
steps: Disconnect mains plug
Press and hold LEARN button while connecting mains plug
Watch ERROR LED
Release LEARN button after 3 seconds (LED is out)
BACK CHECK, LATCH CHECK, and OPEN POSITION revert to defaults
Disconnect mains plug
Next power connection uses default values

spring-pretension-adjustment.title: Spring Pre-tension Adjustment (SPTE)
steps: Factory set is 360° - normally no adjustment needed
Ensure CLTQ and POAS potentiometers are at 0°
Loosen door stop arm
Turn SPTE clockwise until door opens to 45°
Loosen drive arm fixing screw
Move door toward open to reduce tension, toward closed to increase
Tighten drive arm
Turn SPTE to 0°
Open door to required position + ~15mm by turning SPTE clockwise
Mount door stop arm close to open stop block
Turn SPTE to 0°
Push LEARN button and let door complete learn cycle
Max allowable spring pre-tension is 720°

classification-change.title: Change Classification (Low Energy / Full Power)
steps: Disconnect mains plug
Press LEARN button while connecting mains plug
Watch ERROR LED: 3s on, 1s off, 5s on, 5s off, 1s on
Release LEARN button after second 5s has passed
LED flashes to show current classification (1=Full Power, 2=Low Energy)
Push LEARN button to cycle to next classification
Disconnect mains plug when desired classification shown
Perform learn procedure after classification change

switches.MAT: Safety mat enable (requires new learn after change)

door-wont-open.title: Door Won't Open
steps: Disconnect all detectors for testing
Place jumpers across terminals 15-16, 17-18, 19-20
Activate door with jumper across terminals 13 and 14
Check for 110 VAC at Terminals 3 (NEU) and 5 (HOT)
Check 3AT main fuse (single PCB) or 7A fuse (dual PCB) for continuity
Check both 1.5A control fuses for continuity
Inspect PCB for physical damage or burnt components
Verify CAM switches are in correct position per CAM chart
Check switch harness wiring to plugs

motor-not-running.title: Motor Not Running (Motor Windings Test)
steps: Unplug motor from PCB
Short white and black motor leads together
Manually open door
Release door carefully to prevent glass breakage
Observe closing speed:
- If extremely slow: motor windings OK
- If door slams closed: motor windings are open - replace motor
Note: PCB relay will still engage in both cases

motor-fuses-blown.title: Motor Fuses Blown (Dual PCB)
steps: On dual PCB systems, check 3AT fuses in fuse towers
Test fuses for continuity with power disconnected
Replace blown fuses
If fuses blow again, check motor for short

door-holds-open.title: Door Holds Open / Won't Close
steps: Check for short in PCB activate circuit
Check for mechanical problem with operator
If PCB circuit shorted: return PCB to Besam for repair
If mechanical issue: return operator to Besam for repair

door-opens-slow.title: Door Opens Slow
steps: Door may be operating in back check speed
Check for mispositioned CAM
Check back-check switch function with ohm meter (power off)
Adjust or replace back-check switch if defective

door-closes-slow.title: Door Closes Slow
steps: Check PCB relay contacts for pitting or sticking
Replace relay or return PCB to Besam for repair
Check if operating in latch speed - test latch switch with ohm meter
Replace latch switch if defective
Verify closing resistor R-1 value matches operator type

no-speed-control-door-slams.title: No Speed Control / Door Slams Open
steps: Short in motor drive circuits suspected
Return PCB to Besam for repair

door-stops-backcheck-recycles.title: Door Stops at Back-Check and Recycles
steps: Check back-check speed adjustment - may be too low
Verify back-check switch is contacting CAM properly
Check for broken wire to back-check switch
Verify harness wiring is correct

door-closes-fast.title: Door Closes Fast
steps: Check closing resistor R-1 value
Match resistor value to operator type
Replace resistor if incorrect value

troubleshoot-pcb.title: PCB Troubleshooting Setup
steps: Disconnect all detectors
Place jumper across terminals 15-16
Place jumper across terminals 17-18
Place jumper across terminals 19-20
Activate door by placing jumper across terminals 13 and 14
Observe door operation to isolate fault

motor-winding-test.title: Motor Winding Test
steps: DISCONNECT MAINS POWER
Unplug motor connector from PCB
Short white and black motor leads together
Manually push door to open position
Carefully release door (watch for glass)
If door closes very slowly: windings OK
If door slams closed: windings open - replace motor

switch-continuity-test.title: Switch Continuity Test
steps: DISCONNECT MAINS POWER
Use ohm meter to test switch function
Test back-check switch at correct CAM position
Test latch switch at correct CAM position
Verify switches open and close at proper positions

handing-conversion-300.title: 300 Series Handing Conversion
steps: Remove operator from header
Remove switch cover and disconnect switch harness from PCB
Remove CAM and CAM shaft
Reinstall CAM 180° opposite per CAM Chart No. 1
Rewire switches and reinstall switch cover
Reinstall operator
Plug motor into opposite connector
Check panic breakaway function by pushing door in panic direction

models.300: Overhead concealed, double acting, spring return, non-handed
models.305: Same as 300 with light closing spring
models.355: Same as 350 with light closing spring
models.400: Overhead concealed, factory handed, single acting (spring open to panic)
models.405: Same as 400 with light closing spring
models.455: Same as 450 with light closing spring

besam-swingmaster.note: 300 Series is no longer manufactured. When using lockout relay (like BEA LO-21), hold voltage may need to be increased. On 455 operators with lockout, set hold voltage to ~12VDC.

manuals.name: Horton C4190 Setup Instructions for Swing & Folding Doors

no-power.title: No Power / No Voltage
steps: Check power supply at CN1 input for 120VAC
With line voltage present, move to 5-pin power supply lace
Probe through back of plug with VOM - check pins 1&2 for +120VDC
Check pins 3&4 for +24VDC
Move meter leads to 5-pin plug at control and confirm voltages

no-voltage-no-operation-f2.title: No Voltage at CN2 Pins 1&2 (Check F2)
steps: Disconnect 120VAC plug, disconnect 5-pin power supply plug, disconnect motor leads
Replace fuse F2
Check motor for frame short or shorted motor - if OK proceed
Reestablish 120VAC and confirm fuse status
Reestablish 5-pin plug and confirm fuse status
If fuse is blown - control is most likely bad
If fuse is good, reestablish motor connection and test operation

no-voltage-no-operation-f1-f3.title: No Voltage at CN2 Pins 3&4 (Check F1 & F3)
steps: Disconnect 120VAC plug, disconnect 5-pin power supply plug
Disconnect 2-pin motor plug at CN2, remove 12-pin input plug at CN2
Replace low voltage fuse
Check low voltage activation circuit for possible shorts in 24VDC wiring
Check for chafing at frame to door cords or frame to header connections
Reestablish 120VAC and confirm fuse status
If fuse is blown - control is most likely bad
If fuse is good, reestablish CN2 input connection and 2-pin motor plug, test operation

voltage-present-no-operation.title: Voltage Present, No Operation
steps: Confirm D3 (TGL - green) circuit light is ON - if not, check toggle circuit
Quick check: jump pins 5 & 6 of CN2 to test toggle circuit internally
Confirm D2 (SAF - red) Safety Circuit light is OFF
Activate door with external sensor - D1 (ACT - green) should light
If no D1 light: malfunction in circuit or wiring - jump pins 2 & 3 at CN2 to confirm
Confirm SPEED pot (Open Speed) is turned up enough to drive door open

high-speed-no-control.title: Voltage Present, High Speed, No Speed Control
steps: This usually indicates a blown or shorted MOSFET transistor
Control must be replaced
See Section 1 or cover for test point locations before condemning

door-drifts-closed.title: Door Drifts Back / Won't Hold Open
steps: Cycle the door and hold the activation button
Door should open fully - after 10-12 seconds the yellow HOLD indicator should come on
At this point the door will begin drifting slowly back toward closed position
Adjust HOLD pot R32 to stop the drift and allow door to slowly seek open position
Release activation button and allow door to close
Cycle again - door should now maintain full open position without drifting
Yellow HOLD indicator comes on after Stop-n-Seek input (see section 7)

door-opens-too-slow.title: Door Opens Too Slowly
steps: Apply jumper between pins 2 and 3 of CN2 terminal block to activate door to open
Set HOLD pot R32 fully counter-clockwise
Apply line power and cycle the door
Door should open smoothly and quickly, then close after a brief delay
Activate door again and adjust opening characteristics:
SPEED pot R35 - clockwise to increase open speed
CHECK pot R30 - clockwise to increase check speed (after open check switch)
ACCEL pot R38 - clockwise to increase motor acceleration

door-closes-too-slow.title: Door Closes Too Slowly
steps: Locate Closing Speed adjustment knob on operator
Rotate COUNTER-CLOCKWISE to increase closing speed
Suggested setting: 4 seconds minimum close time
FOLDING DOOR NOTE: Maximum closing speed is 1 ft/second per ANSI 156.10
Closing force for folding doors shall not exceed 30 ft.lb (133N) at any point

excessive-opening-force.title: Excessive Opening Force
steps: Set the LIMIT pot R54 fully clockwise (this is mandatory on series 7000)
For series 4000, LIMIT adjustment is optional but highly recommended for safety
Have a helper use Horton's C1435 door pressure scale at the strike rail
Cycle the door and turn LIMIT pot R54 counter-clockwise to set maximum opening force
Low energy (4000LE): Max force 15 lb (6.8kg) per ANSI 156.19
Power operated (7000/4000): Max force 35-50 lb (15.9-22.7kg) per ANSI 156.10
NOTE: If limiting force is set very light, door may have difficulty opening in windy conditions

compliance.folding_opening_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) through last 10 deg from open check
compliance.folding_closing_force: Max 30 ft.lb (133N) at any point in closing cycle

panels-binding.title: Folding Panels Binding or Rubbing
steps: Check track for debris or damage
Inspect pivot hinges between panels for wear or misalignment
Verify panels are properly aligned in track
Check that power arm is positioned correctly (should be ~95 deg or less at full open)
Inspect weather seals for interference
Check floor guide/track for obstructions
For dual controls: verify C4196 harness connections between operators

breakout-not-working.title: Breakout Not Working (Emergency Egress)
steps: Verify C4024-3 breakout cam is installed on center pivot
Factory setting: Switch falls onto cam flat when door is 10 deg from full open
For center pivot hinging units with breakout: cam provides additional functionality
Safety: If breakout stop should fail, the cam prevents closing force from exceeding limits
Check that breakout hardware is not binding or damaged
Test breakout function with power OFF to verify mechanical operation

uneven-panel-travel.title: Uneven Panel Travel (Dual Controls)
steps: For simultaneous operators (pairs): verify both controls are set up identically
Check C4196 harness connection between operators
The power supply harness C3959-4 is used instead of C3959-1 on pairs
Connect CN4 on each control to the other control (for pairs only)
Verify both operators have identical pot settings
Check that both cam settings match (Section 2)
uneven-panel-travel.wiring_note: C4196 harness is ONLY used on SIMULTANEOUS OPERATORS

obstruction-not-detected.title: Obstruction Not Detected / Door Doesn't Reverse
steps: Place an obstruction between the closed door and open check position (around 80 deg)
Cycle the door and adjust OBST pot R56 clockwise until HOLD indicator lights
Door should stop when obstruction is encountered
With hold-open adjustment made in Section 4, any obstruction will stop the door
Door holds open until time delay expires and all safety devices clear
Then door will close

lock-not-releasing.title: Lock Not Releasing / Lock Delay Issues
steps: If lock relay is used, remove jumper JB3 (black, typically marked)
This inserts a 0.25 second delay to allow lock to release before door moves
If lock (magnetic locks) requires more than 0.25 seconds to release:
Locate resistor R17 on control board and carefully cut it out
This increases unlock delay to about 0.75 seconds
Should allow proper operation with all locks
Wire lock to Horton C3881 auxiliary relay module as per diagram 11380.4
Connect C3881 to CN2 as shown
NOTE: Control will provide power for most 25VDC magnetic locks and strikes
Do NOT use on 12 volt DC locks (see diagram 11380.3 for other lock types)

SPEED.function: Open Speed - sets the open speed of the operator from start to open check

CHECK.function: Open Check Speed - sets speed after open check switch falls onto cam flat (approx 80 deg)

ACCEL.function: Open Acceleration - sets motor acceleration to open speed setting

DACCL.function: Open Deceleration - determines how quickly door slows after open check switch trips

HOLD.function: Hold Voltage - controls hold-open voltage after 10-12 second delay from activate or Stop-n-Seek input

DELAY.function: Time Delay - sets desired time delay and check devices for proper operation

L.OUT.function: Lock Out Time Delay - sets length of time to ignore safety sensor during door closing
L.OUT.note: Orange LOCK OUT indicator stays on until door completely closes

LIMIT.function: Current Limiting - sets amount of opening force

OBST.function: Obstruction sensitivity - sets response to obstruction

JB1.note: Push-N-Go is normally on for low energy (series 7000) applications and turned off otherwise

JB2.remove_to: Disable touch stop - door reopens if obstruction encountered before close check
JB2.note: Remove JB2 to disable this feature

JB3.note: Remove if using lock relay to allow lock to release before door starts moving

wiring.dual_control_note: For pairs: use C4196 harness and C3959-4 power supply harness instead of C3959-1

compliance.opening_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) through last 10 deg (open check), measured 1" from lock edge on swing doors and 1" from lead edge of FS leaf
compliance.closing_force_folding: Max 30 ft.lb (133N) at any point in the closing cycle
compliance.opening_speed: Door shall not open in less than 1.5 seconds from start to open check

cam_settings.open_check: Adjust for switch to fall onto cam flat when door is 10 deg from full open
cam_settings.close_check: Adjust for switch to fall flat when door is 10 deg from full closed
cam_settings.breakout: C4024-3 provides additional safety if breakout stop should fail

low_energy_156.19.force_limit: Max 15 ft.lb (67N) applied at any point

compliance.power_failure: Manual pressure not to exceed 15 lb ft (111N) at point 1" from latch edge

manuals.name: Horton C4190 Setup Instructions for Swing & Folding Doors

no-power.title: No Power / No Voltage
steps: Check power supply at CN1 input for 120VAC
With line voltage present, move to 5-pin power supply lace
Probe through back of plug with VOM - check pins 1&2 for +120VDC
Check pins 3&4 for +24VDC
Move meter leads to 5-pin plug at control and confirm voltages

no-voltage-no-operation-f2.title: No Voltage at CN2 Pins 1&2 (Check F2)
steps: Disconnect 120VAC plug, disconnect 5-pin power supply plug, disconnect motor leads
Replace fuse F2
Check motor for frame short or shorted motor - if OK proceed
Reestablish 120VAC and confirm fuse status
Reestablish 5-pin plug and confirm fuse status
If fuse is blown - control is most likely bad
If fuse is good, reestablish motor connection and test operation

no-voltage-no-operation-f1-f3.title: No Voltage at CN2 Pins 3&4 (Check F1 & F3)
steps: Disconnect 120VAC plug, disconnect 5-pin power supply plug
Disconnect 2-pin motor plug at CN2, remove 12-pin input plug at CN2
Replace low voltage fuse
Check low voltage activation circuit for possible shorts in 24VDC wiring
Check for chafing at frame to door cords or frame to header connections
Reestablish 120VAC and confirm fuse status
If fuse is blown - control is most likely bad
If fuse is good, reestablish CN2 input connection and 2-pin motor plug, test operation

voltage-present-no-operation.title: Voltage Present, No Operation
steps: Confirm D3 (TGL - green) circuit light is ON - if not, check toggle circuit
Quick check: jump pins 5 & 6 of CN2 to test toggle circuit internally
Confirm D2 (SAF - red) Safety Circuit light is OFF
Activate door with external sensor - D1 (ACT - green) should light
If no D1 light: malfunction in circuit or wiring - jump pins 2 & 3 at CN2 to confirm
Confirm SPEED pot (Open Speed) is turned up enough to drive door open

high-speed-no-control.title: Voltage Present, High Speed, No Speed Control
steps: This usually indicates a blown or shorted MOSFET transistor
Control must be replaced
See Section 1 or cover for test point locations before condemning

door-drifts-closed.title: Door Drifts Back / Won't Hold Open
steps: Cycle the door and hold the activation button
Door should open fully - after 10-12 seconds the yellow HOLD indicator should come on
At this point the door will begin drifting slowly back toward closed position
Adjust HOLD pot R32 to stop the drift and allow door to slowly seek open position
Release activation button and allow door to close
Cycle again - door should now maintain full open position without drifting
Yellow HOLD indicator comes on after Stop-n-Seek input (see section 7)

door-opens-too-slow.title: Door Opens Too Slowly
steps: Apply jumper between pins 2 and 3 of CN2 terminal block to activate door to open
Set HOLD pot R32 fully counter-clockwise
Apply line power and cycle the door
Door should open smoothly and quickly, then close after a brief delay
Activate door again and adjust opening characteristics:
SPEED pot R35 - clockwise to increase open speed
CHECK pot R30 - clockwise to increase check speed (after open check switch)
ACCEL pot R38 - clockwise to increase motor acceleration

door-closes-too-slow.title: Door Closes Too Slowly
steps: Locate Closing Speed adjustment knob on operator
Rotate COUNTER-CLOCKWISE to increase closing speed
Suggested setting: 4 seconds minimum close time
Refer to ANSI chart for proper closing time based on door leaf width

excessive-opening-force.title: Excessive Opening Force
steps: Set the LIMIT pot R54 fully clockwise (this is mandatory on series 7000)
For series 4000, LIMIT adjustment is optional but highly recommended for safety
Have a helper use Horton's C1435 door pressure scale at the strike rail
Cycle the door and turn LIMIT pot R54 counter-clockwise to set maximum opening force
Low energy (4000LE): Max force 15 lb (6.8kg) per ANSI 156.19
Power operated (7000/4000): Max force 35-50 lb (15.9-22.7kg) per ANSI 156.10
NOTE: If limiting force is set very light, door may have difficulty opening in windy conditions

compliance.swing_opening_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) through last 10 deg from open check
compliance.swing_closing_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) at any point in closing cycle

obstruction-not-detected.title: Obstruction Not Detected / Door Doesn't Reverse
steps: Place an obstruction between the closed door and open check position (around 80 deg)
Cycle the door and adjust OBST pot R56 clockwise until HOLD indicator lights
Door should stop when obstruction is encountered
With hold-open adjustment made in Section 4, any obstruction will stop the door
Door holds open until time delay expires and all safety devices clear
Then door will close

false-obstruction.title: False Obstruction / Door Hangs Up
steps: If presence detector is installed on swing side of door, response will occur ~1 second after obstruction
This prevents false response from wind gusts
If door 'hangs up' with presence detector: increase HOLD adjustment R32 sufficiently
This allows door to creep slowly after encountering an obstruction
Check that LIMIT adjustment is not set very light (may need higher force in adverse conditions)
See Section 6 for LIMIT adjustment

lock-not-releasing.title: Lock Not Releasing / Lock Delay Issues
steps: If lock relay is used, remove jumper JB3 (black, typically marked)
This inserts a 0.25 second delay to allow lock to release before door moves
If lock (magnetic locks) requires more than 0.25 seconds to release:
Locate resistor R17 on control board and carefully cut it out
This increases unlock delay to about 0.75 seconds
Should allow proper operation with all locks
Wire lock to Horton C3881 auxiliary relay module as per diagram 11380.4
Connect C3881 to CN2 as shown
NOTE: Control will provide power for most 25VDC magnetic locks and strikes
Do NOT use on 12 volt DC locks (see diagram 11380.3 for other lock types)

deceleration-too-fast.title: Door Slows Down Too Fast When Opening
steps: If door slows down too fast when switching from open speed to open check:
Adjust DACCL pot R36 - may need to be turned down (counter-clockwise)
DACCL (Open Deceleration) determines how quickly door slows after open check switch engages
Rotate clockwise to increase deceleration (slower transition)
NOTE: Horton recommends DACCL be left at maximum on all low-energy installations
Also recommended where Swing-Stop or Stop-and-Resume features are used

SPEED.function: Open Speed - sets the open speed of the operator from start to open check

CHECK.function: Open Check Speed - sets speed after open check switch falls onto cam flat (approx 80 deg)

ACCEL.function: Open Acceleration - sets motor acceleration to open speed setting

DACCL.function: Open Deceleration - determines how quickly door slows after open check switch trips

HOLD.function: Hold Voltage - controls hold-open voltage after 10-12 second delay from activate or Stop-n-Seek input

DELAY.function: Time Delay - sets desired time delay and check devices for proper operation

L.OUT.function: Lock Out Time Delay - sets length of time to ignore safety sensor during door closing
L.OUT.note: Orange LOCK OUT indicator stays on until door completely closes

LIMIT.function: Current Limiting - sets amount of opening force

OBST.function: Obstruction sensitivity - sets response to obstruction

JB1.note: Push-N-Go is normally on for low energy (series 7000) applications and turned off otherwise

JB2.remove_to: Disable touch stop - door reopens if obstruction encountered before close check
JB2.note: Remove JB2 to disable this feature

JB3.note: Remove if using lock relay to allow lock to release before door starts moving

C8420-36.note: Optional, mounted on swing area side

compliance.opening_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) through last 10 deg (open check), measured 1" from lock edge on swing doors and 1" from lead edge of FS leaf
compliance.closing_force: Max 40 ft.lb (180N) at any point in the closing cycle, measured 1" from lock edge of the door
compliance.opening_speed: Door shall not open in less than 1.5 seconds from start to open check (80 deg or more)

low_energy_156.19.force_limit: Max 15 ft.lb (67N) applied at any point

compliance.power_failure: Manual pressure not to exceed 15 lb ft (111N) at point 1" from latch edge
